text: Nâzım Hikmet Ran (15 January 1902 – 3 June 1963), commonly known as Nâzım Hikmet, was a Turkish poet, playwright and novelist. He was well liked for the "lyrical flow of his statements". Hikmet was often arrested for his political beliefs. He spent much of his adult life in prison or in exile. His poetry has been translated into more than fifty languages. ==References== Category:1902 births Category:1963 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Turkish poets Category:Thessaloniki
title: Nâzım Hikmet Ran
